properties.areaDesc: Martin, IN; Daviess, IN; Dubois, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:08PM EST until January 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Big Blue River...Big Walnut Creek...Buck Creek...Driftwood River...
Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...Flatrock River...
Mill Creek...Mississinewa River...Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...
Wabash River...White River...Wildcat Creek...Youngs Creek...

.Periods of rain, possibly heavy at times, is expected overnight
into Saturday. Total rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with locally
heavier amounts are possible. The forecast rainfall amounts will
result in widespread minor to moderate flooding of area rivers and
streams.

The Flood Warning continues for
The East Fork White River at Shoals.
* from Saturday evening to Sunday January 19.
* At  9:30 PM Friday the stage was 11.2 feet.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday evening and continue
to rise to near 21.3 feet by late Saturday night  and will rise
later to 21.6 by Friday January 17. It will fall below flood stage
by Saturday January 18.
* At 22.0 feet...Lowland flooding affects all local roads in the flood
plain.  Farmers must move some livestock to higher ground.  State
Road 550 floods on left bank.  Roads that flood include West River,
Spout Spring, Cemetery, East River, Chicken Farm and a few other
side roads near the river.  East Fork White River forms at least
one island.  Two families are nearly isolated.  Significant
agricultural flooding is in progress.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
